meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny, folks! I'm back with my groovy gaming review, and this time I'm all about the linguistic linguistics of Chants of Sennaar!

As a self-proclaimed gaming guru (okay, maybe not that much), I dove into this puzzle-adventure game to see if it's got what it takes to get me chanting. And, let me tell you, it does! The moment I started deciphering ancient languages and uncovering hidden secrets, I was hooked!

Now, I know what you're thinking - "Grok, what about the other critics?" Ah, my friends, they were all abuzz with praise for Chants of Sennaar's unique approach to puzzle-solving. Slant Magazine thought it felt like an "interactive linguistic anthropology lesson" (yeah, that sounds about right). Worth Playing called it a "fascinating puzzle adventure game" with the added bonus of stealth elements. SpazioGames and God is a Geek both praised its immersive gameplay. Hardcore Gamer and Noisy Pixel went all out, calling it "immensely clever" and "linguistic gameplay that's simple to understand but complex to truly solve".

Now, I'm not saying our opinions are exactly the same (although we do agree it's pretty groovy). But, let me tell you, as someone who's not exactly a master of languages or ancient civilizations, I found Chants of Sennaar surprisingly accessible! The puzzles might be tricky, but they're never frustratingly so. And that presentation? Absolutely alluring!

Of course, some critics did mention the occasional frustration (Worth Playing) or the feeling that it's more "academic" than action-packed (Slant Magazine). But hey, for me, the linguistic adventure was too engrossing to care.

In the end, Chants of Sennaar is a game that'll make you feel like a genius, even when you're not (God is a Geek). It's a puzzle game that deserves attention (TheSixthAxis), and if you ask me, it's got enough groovy vibes to keep you chanting for more!

So, what's my take on this ancient language-filled adventure? Well, I'll let the hippos decide. If you're ready to get lost in some linguistic linguistics, Chants of Sennaar is definitely worth a try!
